intro: Gaylussacia goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazense huckleberry, is a species of shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark red or black in color. These berries are often consumed by various bird species, aiding in seed dispersal. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the region's biodiversity and ecological balance.
